summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Government Performance and Financial Management Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on May 21, 2024, at 1:00 PM. This meeting will be held both in-person at City Hall and via video conference, with the primary purpose of discussing financial management, budget proposals, and performance metrics related to city operations.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from the April 23, 2024, meeting.
2. Status update on the review of city real estate for development opportunities.
3. Annual review of property tax exemptions for homeowners aged 65 and older or disabled.
4. Presentation of the City Auditor’s Office proposed budget for FY 2024-25.
5. Overview of the planned budget for Information & Technology Services for FY 2024-25.
6. Atmos Dallas Annual Rate Review.
7. Updates on banking depository services and budget accountability reports.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include the annual review of property tax exemptions, which may affect financial planning for the city. The City Auditor’s proposed budget will be discussed, alongside the planned budget for Information & Technology Services, highlighting the city's commitment to technological advancement and data management. 

**Action Items**:  
The committee seeks approval for the meeting minutes and will review various budget proposals and updates, aiming to make informed decisions regarding financial management and resource allocation for the upcoming fiscal year.
